sections.summary: doctorate-prepared registered nurse and medical author with extensive clinical experience, excellent physical assessment skills, proven strength in teaching, and a passion for health education.â specialized training in pediatric primary care, chronic disease management, sports medicine, nutrition, pediatric cardiology, and mental wellness.â excels at presenting health & medical education, and program management. professional highlights played a major role as medical liaison in medical sales venues educatingâ mds, surgeons, apns, rns, and surgical staff while maintaining business benchmarks implemented a sustainable quality improvement program within orland park and quotasâ school district 135's physical education curriculum, impacting over 4800 successful author & editor in preparing medical students grades k-8 manuscripts, proposals, and policies for publication revised a rush university graduate nursing course curriculum improving submission online discussion & critical thinking techniques in accordance with national effective presenter with ability to convey complex quality matters standards â & competencies for nursing education concepts to a variety of audiences and identification of designed course curriculum, including exam design and evaluation, within training needs university graduate level nursing programsâ managed several projects with budget limitations, as currently establishing medical advisory board within orland park well as securing fundingâ township, coordinating with university of chicago and local community experienced in research, data analysis, andâ stakeholders to provide health services and education programs to district documentation of health conditions & treatment topics, students and athletes public health issues, & student safety supported school district staff & community education on physical, cultural, and socioeconomic diversity of student population
